p: In Serbia, six antioxidant activity assays, including metal-chelating (Fe 2+), FRAP, phosphomolybdenum method, OH radical, DPPH, and ABTS radical scavenging activity were carried out on E. vulgare and E. rubrum. It was subsequently determined that E. vulgare contains higher antioxidant activity, including higher TPC and TFC values [ 58]. Again, this outcome could explain the rich ethnomedicinal use of E. vulgare in the Mediterranean area for centuries.
